intro: Guatteria cestrifolia, commonly known as the Mexican huito, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, fleshy berries. Its fruits are often consumed raw or used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
